p: We found that HIV-positive MSM/TG who had bought sex from a man in the past 12 months were more likely to be virally suppressed. Our findings could possibly reflect a higher recognition of risk and thus increased care engagement among those buying sex, but we are not able to determine causality. Studies among other MSM/TG populations have found that substance use, alcohol use and mental health are associated with worse care cascade outcomes[ 45], and the fact that we did not find statistically significant associations with these characteristics should be treated with caution. Our sub-sample was small, statistical error remains a possibility and we have not disaggregated different types of drug use.
